testsuite.name: Authentication Process
testsuite.system-out:
Feature: Authentication Process As a registered member in the system I want to have access to all of its internal features, which are only accessible after a successful login procedure
--Output from -- #@ignore Scenario: # Authentication.feature:6 ENTROU no signIn Enabled == truetargeturi: ENTROU NO TRYJefferson Almeida Given I am at the Member Listagem page # AuthenticationSteps.groovy:32 When I select the "Principal" menu option # AuthenticationSteps.groovy:41 Then I am redirected to the Publications Menu page # AuthenticationSteps.groovy:45
--Output from -- #@ignore Scenario: # Authentication.feature:12 Given I am at the Login Page # AuthenticationSteps.groovy:49 When I try to login with an user that does not exist # AuthenticationSteps.groovy:52 Then A login failure message is displayed # AuthenticationSteps.groovy:56
--Output from -- #@ignore Scenario: # Authentication.feature:18 ENTROU no registerparams NULL Given I am at the Registration Page # AuthenticationSteps.groovy:61 ENTROU no register When I register a user with success # AuthenticationSteps.groovy:64 Then A message indicating the user was successfully registered is displayed at login page # AuthenticationSteps.groovy:68
--Output from -- #@ignore Scenario: # Authentication.feature:24 Given The system has no user with an "invalid email" # AuthenticationSteps.groovy:15 When I try to create a "newuser" with an "invalid email" # AuthenticationSteps.groovy:20 Then It won't save the "newuser" with the "invalid email" # AuthenticationSteps.groovy:25
--Output from -- Scenario: # Authentication.feature:29 Given I'm at the login page # AuthenticationSteps.groovy:88 ENTROU no signIn Enabled == falsetargeturi: When I miss the password for a user that is not enabled # AuthenticationSteps.groovy:93 Then A message of login failed is displayed # AuthenticationSteps.groovy:98
